thread.title: No Lights, no Lorde: impersonator dupes Auckland partygoers | Music
thread.title_full: No Lights, no Lorde: impersonator dupes Auckland partygoers | Music | The Guardian

author: Elle Hunt
title: No Lights, no Lorde: impersonator dupes Auckland partygoers | Music
text:
New Zealand has been sent in a tailspin after a surprise performance by Lorde at an Auckland public library was found to have been by a convincing impersonator.
The pop star was widely reported by attendees of the weekly No Lights No Lycra dance party to have made a guest appearance to perform her new single, Green Light , on Monday night.
A â€œsuper ultra special guestâ€ had been teased in the lead-up to the event, billed as a â€œweekly hour of dance freedom in total darknessâ€ at the Grey Lynn library for a door charge of NZ$7.
Lorde: Green Light review â€“ comeback track signals new dance diva direction Read more 
â€œTotal darknessâ€ apparently worked in the impersonatorâ€™s favour, with many of those in attendance excitedly posting on social media about Lordeâ€™s surprise appearance.
â€œYou know you are in Auckland City when Lorde casually rocks out as the surprise guest at your local No Lights No Lycra hosted at the community library,â€ posted one attendee on Facebook. â€œThose are some pretty stoked faces right there!â€
Another thanked Ella Yelich Oâ€™Connor, â€œa.k.a. #Lorde you secret ninja you, surprising us like that and your voice was amazing live in the little hall in the dark!â€
the prij (@theprij) When you go to No Lights No Lycra and the last track is Lorde performing Green Light LIVE ğŸ’ƒğŸ½ğŸ’ƒğŸ½
March 27, 2017 â€œBut she wasnâ€™t there,â€ as the New Zealand Herald reported on Tuesday .
â€œIn fact, sheâ€™s currently thousands of kilometres away eating Creme Eggs with her mum in London.â€
The pop starâ€™s mother, Sonia Yelich-Oâ€™Connor, had responded to an excited report on Twitter, calling it â€œweirdâ€: â€œWe are in London [right now] â€“ me n @lordeâ€, adding the Union Jack emoji.

Sonja Yelich (@sonjayelich1) @theprij weird - we are in London rn - me n @lorde ğŸ‡¬ğŸ‡§
March 27, 2017 â€œWe in London,â€ confirmed Lorde on Instagram, with a photo of herself eating a Creme Egg.
She later tweeted of the furore that it was â€œdeeply fake news but quite cuteâ€.

Lorde (@lorde) @chelseajade @crobker this is deeply fake news but quite cute lol
March 27, 2017 The No Lights No Lycra crowd had been primed to expect a â€œsuper ultra special guestâ€ by organiser Craig Neilson.
He posted on Facebook on Tuesday morning that the cat was â€œout of the bagâ€, naming the Lorde impersonator as Hannah Horsfield, a music student at Auckland University.
Lorde: Green Light review â€“ comeback track signals new dance diva direction Read more 
He told the Guardian that, of the crowd of approximately 100 people, â€œnearly everyone went away convinced that it was the real dealâ€.
â€œI really expected that people would be leaving the hall a bit uncertain, but I guess I really shouldnâ€™t have underestimated Hannah.â€
Neilson had told New Zealandâ€™s Newshub that the prank was an â€œearly celebrationâ€ of April Fools Day, to which Newshub drily added: â€œThe April Fools prank was played ... almost a week before April 1.â€
Asked by the Guardian whether Monday 27 March was not a bit premature, he said: â€œWe celebrate Christmas from the start of October, so ... â€
New Zealanders responded to the prank with bemusement on social media.
Eddy Dever (@EddyDever) Name a more iconic Auckland hoax than @lorde performing (not performing) at No Lights No Lycra
March 27, 2017 Eli Matthewson (@EliMatthewson) More like No Lights No Lorde lololol
March 27, 2017 Joseph Moore (@josephmoore1) Incredible! @lorde was the surprise adjudicator at my junior certificate debate last night!
March 27, 2017 The Guardian, and Lorde, and Lordeâ€™s mum, and everyone who follows either of them on Twitter can confirm that Lorde is still in London.
Her second album, Melodrama, is due to be released on 16 June.
